ratings.comment: One of my two favorite professors, ever. You are missing out on a lot if you don't take this class, with this professor. The lectures were fascinating, the learning objectives were clear, and the exams were fair. You won't find a better opportunity to learn biochemistry anywhere else!

By far my favorite professor.  His exams are hard, but everything you need to know is covered in lectures.  If you ever don't understand something, just go to his office hours and he can clear things up easily.

Dave nelson is a great professor. He loves to teach and has been doing it for over 30 years. Not quite as good a lecturer is Cox but teaches the more interesting material. Exams require tons of memorization and can therefore be hard but thats biochemistry. Graded on historical curve and we rocked it, 37% of the class got A, 13% got AB.

Great guy, fun to listen to but is very unorganized and not prepared for lecture. He is often surprised at what is in his own power-points. At review sessions he just talks and make hand gestures rather than actually writing things down. The assigned readings and optional problems do NOT match up with the lectures.

His lecture covers basic metabolisms in organisms. Very helpful material and his teaching is very clear. Because of what he teaches, his part of the course requires a lot of memorization, however the content itself isn't that difficult.

Best professor I've had in undergrad. He is extremely knowledgable, obviously loves teaching and is very good at it! He kept me interested every lecture. Also very helpful outside of class. I would recommend him to anyone interested in Biochemistry!

great professor, very friendly and helpful. though lectures can be overwhelming, podcasts and study goals are very useful. it's a class that requires effort though, but if you're good at memorizing this class should be alright.
